import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Get site status type by ID"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/sites/status/types/{SiteStatusTypeId}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Retrieves detailed information about a specific site status type identified by its UUID. Site status types define the lifecycle stages a tenant can be in (e.g., Testing, Production, Onboarding).

**Prerequisites**
1. **SiteStatusTypeId** - Use [GET /api/v1.0/sites/status/types](/docs/api/sites/list-site-status-types) to list all status types. Extract `Items[].SiteStatusTypeId` from the response.

**Use Cases**
- Display status type details in site administration interfaces
- Validate status type configuration before updating site status
- Determine if a status type represents an onboarding or active state

**Response Fields**
- `SiteStatusTypeId` - UUID for the status type
- `Name` - Display name (e.g., "Testing", "Production", "Onboarding")
- `DisplayOrder` - Sort position for UI rendering
- `IsActive` - Whether sites can currently be assigned this status
- `IsOnboarding` - True if this status indicates the site is still being set up

**Workflow Example**
1. List status types: [GET /api/v1.0/sites/status/types](/docs/api/sites/list-site-status-types) → find target `SiteStatusTypeId`
2. Get details: [GET /api/v1.0/sites/status/types/\{SiteStatusTypeId\}](/docs/api/sites/get-site-status-type-by-id)

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"SiteStatusTypeId","in":"path","required":true,"description":"Unique identifier for the site status type.","schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"},"example":"999a2b63-7bf4-49f9-a2a3-aa739e000060"}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
